page.title: 04FARMING IN 1985
page.content: Dad normally gets up at 5.45am . In winter the cows stay inside because it is warm in their shed. There is silage in the shed because we put it in every morning using a conveyer belt with the silager. We have two silage clamps to put the silage in. In winter Carl normally feeds the cows inside. This goes on until March when we start silaging again. That takes us about three weeks. After silaging we start to hay lead. We dont get much hay only about four loads, which we buy from Liddles, a nearby farm.We then do a second cut of silage and put that in the second clamp. Then later on we lead straw. Last year we had a lot of square bales and 1,800 round bales. Square bales are made using a small baler and older machinery,while the newest machinery makes much larger round bales.
